page.title: 10Grindleford Station
page.content: Passenger accomodation is limited to small open 'Bus shelter' type covered area on each platform. The wooden buildings which once housed the ticket office, booking hall and porters accomodation, located adjaicent to the overbridge straddling the east of the station survives and is now used as a cafe serving the needs of hikers and ramblers. The goods yards on both the up and down directions are still in situ but have not been used to deal with local merchandice such as coal since 1983. The goods yard continues to be the distribution centre of the coal merchants John Morton (fuel) limited, who now receive all deliveries by road transport.
